nodes.label: People being racist
standing up for yourself is considered talking back
waking up so early
Having to keep up with all the work and homework
School Fights
Frustration with family.
Fake people
trying not to be seen as just a part of your 'group'
the people who harass you everyday just for existing??
The way most middle schoolers are expected to know what they want to do by the time they graduate
trying not to humiliate yourself or doing something people can make fun of
Dress code
People disregard the fact that you're a person to and just because they don't personally like something about you means they can judge you for it
When kids behind you make chewing noises behind you
Your family expects you to be the best
betrayal when close ones say things or do things that aren't loyal to you or other close ones
Often, you can say something and everyone will look at you as if you're weird.

Regulating the way people see you is something hard about middle school. When you are associated with someone that might do something bad or something that negatively represents you, this same view can be presented onto you, making someone see you as bad.
STAIRS
adults are hypocrites, they tell you what to do but do not follow it
Non-friend peers
Bullying
When people are rude for no reason and make you feel bad about yourself.
being sexualized
the amount of people who seem to hate your guts you just for the fun of it.
the always having to be perfect
adults never admit that they are wrong
making and maintaining relationships
Thinking that you have to compete with your peers to have the best work.
The pressure of keeping up appearances of what everyone thinks of you and keeping track of who thinks what of you.
How many class presentations become awkward.
the feeling that you will never be good enough for your family or yourself.
The heavy books
being loud and annoying for no reason
Your click is your identity and so it matters who you spend time with
Friends
feeling like you'll be a failure if you're not getting good grades
living up to everyone's expectations
The fact that often, it's easy to become lost and disoriented with you surrounded, or be confused about people's habits.
judgement
A lot of things that happen when going back and forth between home and school such as being cat called, potentially kidnapped, constant worry that something may happen on the bus/walk home
it's easy to hurt people when you don't want to
when your friends change and you don't like them anymore but you can't tell them
Academic Expectations
the food they serve is 99% of the time is well below par
It can be hard to focus in class.
People being sexist
No air conditioning.
people who are disrespectful and rude
Whenever people in your class keep being sat next to each other even though whenever they are sat next to each other they are the loudest people ever.
constant threat of sexual abuse
people who don't respect your personal space
Judgmental looks and stares leading into peer pressure
not fitting in/ not being the "norm"
keeping who you are to your family and friends different
when teachers stop reading the book when your very interested
Everyone seems to be judging you.
Dances
Everything being a competition and it sucks the fun out of anything
Discriminating against people who have disabilities.
having to always be above average in your eyes
School life
Accommodations not being made for people with undiagnosed disabilities/disorders or mental illnesses
making new friends and keeping old friends
you have to be so many different people in different contexts
fitness testing
Punishing the whole class because of one person
never knowing how you're doing until it is too late
Something terrible about middle school is not only the criticism but also the amount of unsolicited crap and hate that people give you.
Students making fun of other students for their religion.
not being able to be yourself
Whenever people are rude for no reason.
Everyone thinks things of you that may or may not be true and base their whole view of you on that

Going through school with high expectations about yourself is something hard about middle school. Whenever you try to accomplish things, you may constantly feel the need to overachieve and do more than is required in order to prove that your mind and knowledge goes above what is expected of you.
losing your sense of belonging
How it's dangerous to walk in downtown
Feeling like a fake
The social structures that everyone expects you to fit into and they see you as everyone else in your "tier" of the social structure.
Disgusting School Lunches (Although this does apply to all school)
Trying to live up to expectations
overthinking every conversation
HATE
People rejecting others based on their looks
anti-semitism
the learning
fear of expressing yourself because people will think of you if you do something wrong, which can usually cause someone to be anxious or overthinking.
You don't know enough about something before the class moves on
the food
No one completely respects you
the amount of stress and anxiety caused by academic pressure
classes being far apart from each other
Home life
The pacing of the schoolwork.
The low quality of the school lunches
more work and less time
The way the some of the kids bully others just to look cool or be popular.
People turn on you
missing the bus
No one knows who they are
Non-Academic Expectations
you're judged by your siblings
People fighting over nothing
Kids making death threats and almost fulfilling them
Adults
The teachers not caring
Your always expected to achieve more than everyone else
Certain standards for people, the way teenagers are treated just because they're teenagers.
